name: Continue
description: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body.
whenToUse: Used when the client sends large payloads and waits for server approval.

name: Switching Protocols
description: The server is switching protocols as requested by the client.
whenToUse: Used during protocol upgrades like HTTP to WebSocket.

name: OK
description: The request was successful.
whenToUse: Standard response for successful GET, PUT, DELETE.

name: Created
description: A new resource was successfully created.

name: Accepted
description: The request has been accepted for processing but not completed.
whenToUse: Use for async or background processing.

example.message: Request accepted and will be processed later.

name: No Content
description: The request was successful but there is no response body.

name: Moved Permanently
description: The resource has been permanently moved to a new URL.

name: Found
description: The resource is temporarily located at a different URL.

name: Not Modified
description: The cached version of the resource is still valid.

name: Temporary Redirect
description: Temporary redirect without changing HTTP method.

name: Permanent Redirect
description: Permanent redirect without changing HTTP method.

name: Bad Request
description: Invalid request syntax or data.

name: Unauthorized
description: Authentication is required.

name: Forbidden
description: User is authenticated but not authorized.

name: Not Found
description: The requested resource does not exist.

name: Method Not Allowed
description: HTTP method is not supported for this endpoint.

name: Request Timeout
description: The client took too long to send the request.

name: Conflict
description: Request conflicts with the current state of the resource.

name: Payload Too Large
description: Request entity is too large.

name: Unsupported Media Type
description: Unsupported request content type.

name: Unprocessable Entity
description: Validation errors in the request.

name: Too Many Requests
description: Rate limit exceeded.

example.message: Too many requests. Try again later.

name: Internal Server Error
description: Generic server failure.

name: Not Implemented
description: The server does not support the requested functionality.

name: Bad Gateway
description: Invalid response from upstream server.

name: Service Unavailable
description: Server is temporarily unavailable.

name: Gateway Timeout
description: Upstream server failed to respond in time.
